sourceMeaningMnemonic: <radical>Gambler</radical>s usually only see the <radical>sun</radical> at <kanji>dawn</kanji>. They gamble all day and through the night, and if they leave it's at the crack of dawn to get home, clean up, and then go back. I haven't known a gambler who's seen the sun ... well ever!
meaningInfo: Imagine being a gambler and seeing the bright dawn sun when you come out of the casino or pachinko parlor. It burns your eyes! Evil dawn, get back inside quick!
readingMnemonic: If you're up at <kanji>dawn</kanji> you'll also see the <ja><reading>あか</reading></ja> (red) <ja><reading>つき</reading></ja> (moon). The <ja>あかつき</ja> only happens as the sun comes up at dawn so usually only gamblers see it. But if you get up early, you can see it too!
readingInfo: Imagine getting up at dawn and seeing the <ja>あかつき</ja> in the sky near the sun. It's so beautiful!
